intro: Neoschischkinia truncatula, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, clustered flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant prefers well-draining soil and bright, indirect light to thrive. It is popular as a houseplant due to its ease of care and ornamental value. Neoschischkinia truncatula is also known for its ability to produce offsets, which can be propagated to create new plants.
